chargeHist.descr: Possess w/ Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine (>3-10g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy D Northup was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possession of Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**64 days credit if probation revoked.**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Reminder Notice - Resent to address provided by USPS
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant with DNA form.

(8:30 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jeremy D Northup in court, in custody. Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Jeremy D Northup.
Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Prior offense acknowledged for Repeater enhancers.
Defendant pleads No Contest to Amended Count 3: Misdemeanor Bail Jumping as Repeater and Count 5: Possession of Drug Paraphernalia as a Party to a Crime and as Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of Amended Count 3 and Count 5.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 1 year on 22CF575 Amended Count 3 with the following conditions:
30 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Must testify truthfully in any legal matter which the defendant is subpoenaed for. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. 64 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 

Court orders sentence on 22CF575 Count 5 for the defendant to provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs.

Dated 07/11/2022, Letter from ADA Kirkpatrick to Court regarding co-defendant and scheduling.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 28, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Motion hearing on July 28, 2022 at 08:00 am.

(Case called at 11:30 AM) Defendant Jeremy D Northup in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Jeremy D Northup.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Arraignment- Defense waives reading of Information, enters Not Guilty pleas on all counts. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. 
Bail Bond Hearing- State makes argument for cash bond being reduced to a signature bond, but would stipulate to $1,000 cash bond. Defense makes argument for signature bond or $250 cash bond. State responds with further argument. 
Court orders $1,000 cash bond- all previous conditions remain. Defense requests motion hearing and 2 Day speedy jury trial be scheduled, indicates paperwork will be filed at a later date. Off the record for scheduling. 
Motion Hearing and Final Status Conference: 7/28/2022 at 8:00 AM (set for 1 hour in person). 2 Day Jury Trial: August 22-23, 2022. Court indicates if the drug results cannot be back in time for the trial- counsel should schedule a scheduling conference.
Same as Complaint.
Bail/bond hearing on July 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Arraignment on July 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond
Arraignment on July 11, 2022 at 09:45 am.

(2:36 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jeremy D Northup in court, in custody. Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Jeremy D Northup.
Parties advise are ready to proceed. 
State calls Officer Steven Haller of the August Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.  
State requests the Court take judicial notice of the bond in Marathon County case 20CF1092 and in Trempealeau County case 22CF42. Attorney Cook has no objection. Court takes judicial notice of the bond in Marathon County case 20CF1092 and Trempealeau County case 22CF42.
State conducts direct of Officer Haller.
Attorney Cook conducts cross-examination of Officer Haller. Witness excused.
State moves for bind over. Attorney Cook requests the charges of Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine and Possession of Methamphetamine as well as Felony Bail Jumping be dismissed.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Attorney Cook to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.

(11:19 AM case called.) Court Commissioner Dan Smetana for Branch 2.
Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jeremy D Northup appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Zebulon Patek appeared by video for Jeremy D Northup.
Defendant advised of charges and potential penalties. 
State requests $5,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Patek requests signature bond or $200.00 cash bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $1,500.00 cash bond with conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with co-def N.T.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
